And one of the key tenants of it was that it should cost the same to mail a letter across the street or across the country so that things like news could be sent to the furthest reaches of the country.  It was created to level the playing field for all Americans so that even the poorest could afford to send mail and not just the wealthy as it had been prior.  If you've never priced out FedEx to send a letter you should go give it a shot.  You'll find they charge 10x what the Post Office does for lesser service.
